verses.text: 祭過偶像的食物的問題關於祭過偶像的食物，我們曉得我們都有知識。但知識會使人自高自大，唯有愛心能造就人。

words.note: Refers to a sculpted or carved image worshipped as a god.

breakdown.m: in, on, at, with regard to

words.note: More formal or literary than 知道 (zhīdào).
An idiom describing someone who thinks highly of themselves.
Often used in a religious or compassionate sense, meaning 'loving heart'.
In a biblical context, it refers to spiritual building up.

verses.text: 如果有人自以為知道些甚麼，那麼，他應該知道的，他還是不知道。

words.note: Indicates a presumptuous or mistaken self-assessment.
Turns the preceding clause into a noun phrase, 'what he should know'.

verses.text: 如果有人愛 神，這人是 神所知道的。

words.note: The space before 神 (Shén) is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to emphasize the singular God.
Used with verbs to form a passive voice or to nominalize a verb phrase.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'what God knows' or 'known by God'.

verses.text: 關於吃祭過偶像的食物，我們知道世上的偶像算不得甚麼，也知道 神只有一位，沒有別的神。

breakdown.m: in, on, at, with regard to

words.note: An idiomatic expression meaning 'to be of no consequence or value'.
Here refers to other deities, not the singular God.

verses.text: 雖然有被稱為神的，無論在天上或在地上（就如有許多的「神」許多的「主」），

words.note: Refers to those falsely called gods.
Turns the preceding clause into a noun phrase, 'those who are called gods'.

verses.text: 然而我們只有一位 神，就是父；萬物都是從他而來，我們也為了他而活。我們也只有一位主，就是耶穌基督；萬物都是藉著他而有的，我們也是藉著他而有的。

words.note: The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible formatting.
Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 不過，這種知識不是人人都有的。有些人直到現在習慣了拜偶像的事，因此他們吃的時候，就把這些食物看作是真的獻過給偶像的；他們的良心既然軟弱，就被污穢了。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual weakness in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 其實食物不能使我們親近 神，我們不吃也無損，吃也無益。

words.definition: to draw near, be close to
words.note: Used in a spiritual sense here: draw near to God.
The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible formatting.

verses.text: 然而你們要謹慎，免得你們這自由成了軟弱的人的絆腳石。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual weakness in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 因為如果有人看見你這有知識的人，在偶像的廟裡吃喝，他的良心若是軟弱，他不就放膽去吃那祭過偶像的食物嗎？

words.note: Often refers to spiritual weakness in biblical contexts.
Used to form a rhetorical question.
Often implies spiritual boldness in biblical context.

verses.text: 因此，基督已經為他死了的那軟弱的弟兄，就因你的知識而滅亡了。

words.note: Lit. 'because of this'
In a religious context, refers to fellow believers.
Often used in a spiritual or ultimate sense in the Bible.

verses.text: 你們這樣得罪弟兄，傷了他們軟弱的良心，就是得罪基督了。

words.note: Lit. 'to incur guilt/sin'.
In a religious context, refers to fellow believers.
Lit. 'to incur guilt/sin'.

verses.text: 所以，如果食物使我的弟兄跌倒，我就永遠不再吃肉，免得使我的弟兄跌倒了。

words.note: In a religious context, refers to fellow believers.
Often used in the Bible to describe spiritual falling or moral failure.
Lit. 'to avoid obtaining'.
In a religious context, refers to fellow believers.
Often used in the Bible to describe spiritual falling or moral failure.
